page.title: 20OLD RESIDENT - IDEN GREEN
page.content:
A local village well loved person Aunt Kate as she is known by all young and old alike came to the village 45 years ago during the War. There was only a few houses in the main street, 2 pubs and 2 shops. A butchers shop was a mile away and she had to walk everywhere. There were no buses,no telephones and no electricity. She says that people are more friendlier and helpful than when she first came. She is 85 years old but in the past years has nursed families in confinement and laid out the dead.
**************************
COMPILED BY: Dawne Bailey,Betty Bodard, Leslie Burvill, Pat Gleadow, Katharine Gray, Helen Lewis, Kathy Mynard, Ursula Strouts. Photographs: John Lewis.
